responses: I'm sorry, I didn't get that. Could you rephrase?

Hello!

Hi! Need help with something?

patterns: Can I enroll after the deadline?
I missed the enrollment date, can I still apply?
What if I'm late for enrollment?
Is there a grace period for enrollment?
I forgot the deadline, what can I do?
Am I allowed to enroll after cutoff?
Can I still join after classes start?
responses: Yes, late enrollment is allowed until July 15, but there may be an additional fee.
We are accepting late enrollment until the second week of July.
Please visit the registrar's office for assistance with late enrollment.
You may still enroll, but you'll need to fill out a late enrollment form.
Late enrollment is possible but depends on your course and availability.

patterns: What do I need to enroll?
What documents are needed for enrollment?
What should I prepare to enroll?
List of documents needed to enroll?
What should I bring for registration?
Are there any forms to fill out?
Do I need my birth certificate to enroll?
responses: You need your transcript, ID, and completed application form.
Please prepare your high school card, birth certificate, and 2x2 ID picture.
Make sure to bring your valid ID and a filled-out enrollment form.
Requirements vary by program, but generally include a transcript and ID.
Visit our website or registrar for the full list of required documents.

patterns: What programs are available for enrollment?
Can you give me a list of programs?
responses: We offer Computer Science, Information Technology, and Computer Engineering.
Available programs include CS, IT, and Computer Engineering.
Our school offers various tech-related courses. Check our brochure or website.
Visit the admissions page for the full list of programs.
Yes! We have programs in the fields of technology and engineering.

patterns: What is the deadline for enrollment?
Do I still have time to enroll?
responses: The deadline for enrollment is June 30.
Enrollment ends on June 30, so be sure to register before then.
Make sure to submit your documents before June 30.
You can still enroll if it's before June 30.
June 30 is the last day of enrollment.

patterns: How do I find the registrar?
Where can I get enrollment forms?
Where should I go to enroll?
Where do I ask about enrollment?
responses: It's located on the 2nd floor of the admin building.
Go to the admin building, 2nd floor, that's where the registrar is.
You'll find the registrar beside the cashier's office upstairs.
Registrar's office is near the main entrance, 2nd level.
Ask the front desk for directions to the registrar office.
Goodbye!
See you next time!
Have a great day!
Thanks for chatting!
Take care!

patterns: Can you give me the breakdown of tuition?
What is the cost per semester?
Do you have flexible payment plans?
How much do I need to pay?
responses: Tuition fees vary by program. On average, it ranges from ₱25,000 to ₱40,000 per semester.
You can ask for the full breakdown from the finance office.
Each program has different fees. Please check with the cashier or registrar.

patterns: How can I apply for a scholarship?
Can I get a discount on tuition?
Is there a scholarship for athletes?
Do you give scholarships to honor students?
Can I apply for government financial aid?
Do I need high grades to get a scholarship?
How much does a scholarship cover?
responses: Yes, we offer several scholarships based on academic performance and financial need.
Scholarships are available for qualified students. Visit the scholarship office for info.
We also accept government grants like CHED UniFAST.
Athletic and academic scholarships are available.
You can apply online or through the admissions office before June 15.

patterns: How do I enroll through the website?
Can I submit my documents online?
Do I have to go to school to enroll?
responses: Yes, you can enroll online through our student portal.
Visit https://eportal.ubaguio.edu/ to start your online enrollment.
Online applications are accepted. Just upload your documents.
Follow the instructions on our admissions website. You can visit ubaguio.edu/online-enrollment-procedures for a complete guide.
Contact the registrar if you need help with online steps.
Log in to the portal, select 'Enrollment', pick your subjects, and follow the steps to complete your registration.

patterns: How can I contact the registrar?
Do you have a contact number?
Who can I talk to for enrollment help?
Where can I ask questions about enrollment?
What is the school's contact info?
Is there someone I can talk to?
Who do I contact for issues?
responses: You can reach the registrar's office at (074) 123-4567 or email registrar@school.edu.ph.
Call or send an email for enrollment inquiries.
Visit our Facebook page or website for more contact options.
The registrar is available during weekdays, 8AM to 5PM.
You may also message our student support line for faster replies.

patterns: Do I need to take an entrance exam?
How do I register for the test?
Are there review materials for the entrance exam?
Is the entrance exam required for all courses?
Can I take the entrance test online?
How much is the exam fee?
What if I fail the entrance test?
responses: Yes, an entrance exam is required for most programs.
The exam schedule is every Monday and Thursday until June 20.
You can register for the exam through our admissions portal.
The test includes math, English, and logic sections.
Bring a valid ID and your application receipt to take the exam.

patterns: How do I re-enroll if I stopped studying?
Can I enroll again after being inactive?
I'm a returning student, what should I do?
Do I need to reactivate my student account?
responses: Returning students must visit the registrar's office and fill out a reactivation form.
Yes, you can re-enroll. Please contact your department for evaluation first.
Submit your old student ID number and request for reactivation before enrolling.
The process for returning students includes document revalidation and subject evaluation.

patterns: I'm a transferee, what are the requirements?
How do I enroll as a transferee?
responses: Transferees must submit a transcript of records, transfer credentials, Certificate of Good Moral, and a photocopy of your PSA Birth Certificate.
Yes, we accept transferees. Visit the admissions office for an evaluation.
Subject crediting depends on your previous program and school.
For more detailed information, you can visit https://ubaguio.edu/transferees/.

patterns: How do I shift to another program?
What's the process to change my course?
I want to switch from IT to CS
responses: Yes, you can apply for a program change by submitting a shifting form.
Visit your current department adviser and request shifting guidelines.
Course shifting is allowed before the enrollment period ends.
Make sure to get approval from both departments before processing your request.
You can download the shifting form from https://ubaguio.edu/shifting-of-program/​.
For more detailed information, you can visit  https://ubaguio.edu/shifting-of-program/.​

patterns: What are the requirements for foreign students?
How do I enroll as an international student?
I'm from another country, can I apply?
responses: Yes, we accept international students. You need authenticated school records, a certificate of good moral character, affidavit of support, police clearance from your home country, and a copy of your passport bio and visa pages.
You can visit https://ubaguio.edu/international-students for the full list of requirements and procedures.
